resources.string: This is an application designed inside the program of Google Developer Challenge Scholarship track Android Basic. This is a demo of using Fragment to create an application with multiscreens
All code is hosted in this github repository. Feel free to contact me for further information
What do you know about Hamburg?
Hamburg,also as known as Free and Hanseatic Hamburg. It is the second largest city in Germany, locates in the nord of the country
It has a population of 1.8 milliion people
The weather in Hamburg is especially nice in summer, which is from Juni to August. In winter it\'s quite cold and rains a lot
The city is a tourist destination for both domestic and international visitors, ranked 18th in the world for livability in 2016

Hamburg Habour is one of the most important harbours in Germany. With a long walk and coast, you can either go on foot along this or take a ferry. Hamburg harbour is also one of most popular places, where people go to in summer for sunbathing. Harbour\'s birthday is in May and there are thousands of tourists every year there"

Located in the center of the city, Reeperbahn is one of the most famous places in Hamburg. It\'s as known as the Redlight district. The whole area is very active at night. There are bunch of restaurants, bars, discos, sex shops, dancing clubs etc. If you visit Hamburg, it\'s one of the place you can not miss

Also as known as the work place of parliament.This is actually the new city whole, which was built after the historical flame in Hamburg. An amazing architect design with a large square in front of. If you are walking down the city, don\'t forget to drop over here

A long and large lake in the heart of the city, Alster lake is one of the most relaxing places. There are a lot of coffee shops around the lake. If you go to Hamburg in summer, don\'t forget to hire a bike and drive around the lake. In middle of the lake there is the a huge sculpture of a lady bathing.

This is the new part of Hamburg with modern architect. Take some time and walk around. It has an amazing design and is very warm in winter and cool in summer.This is where the whole entertainment companies locate, as well as offices and international firms

As known as one of the biggest cities for evanglish. Hamburg has in total 5 biggest churches, which you can even see from above(for example from Dockland in habour). There are some very old churches from 2. World War, which they want to keep as a historical sign, to remind everyone of the dark side of the war

They city gives you a huge variety of museum, from art to technology.Take a look at the city map and decide to visit some. I would recommend the maritime museum with 9 stocks of all small, big models of ships, the electricity museum with all old devices from the beginning of electricity. A tour to underground of Hamburg is also one thing you should not miss. Remember to book it as soon as possible, because it normally takes over a week to get it

Every sunday morning from 8 to 10:30. If you love to enjoy the fresh air of the hanseatic city, don\'t miss the fish market. Go to buy some fish, fresh vegetables or fruit and take a fresh breathe in the morning in the harbour. Your day will be a good day
An amazing water play with classical music. Only available in summer

A 90-minute tour through the history of Hamburg with a very real feeling from a profession theater team. From the historical flame, which destroyed two third of the city till the epidemics, which killed almost people
There is a collection of small models of a lot of famous city in the world. A small and detail, as real as unbelievable
Have you ever wonder what\'s like to like as a blind. Here is a place where you can try it. Try to live, eat and work all in the darkness
If you are a fan a universe, don\'t forget to come over here. They have amazing shows every week for very reasonable price. Take a seat and let you fly to the moon, the galaxy far far away...
If you are a fan of shopping, you are in the right place. There are shopping streets, shopping malls, shopping centers every where in the city

It\'s a must if you visit Hamburg. Five famous musical theaters with amazing effect and actors gives you a real feeling like playing a role in the play. They are quite expensive, around 100 euro per person. But if you have the chance, don\'t miss it
A coffee or a dinner? You are in the eating street of Hamburg
There are a lot of flea markets in Hamburg on weekend. The biggest one locates near train station Feldstraße There are second hand products but very good quality for a cheap price.
Twice a year. Hamburger Dom is a entertainment place with tons of game and food
If you are here on christmas, you are very lucky. Go along some christmas market here to feel the warmth of fried potato or try some Glühwein
A eis skating place locates in the border of Planten und Blomen
Give you some relaxing time and lay down lazy in the park. Taking a nap or meeting with friends is both good choices to relax in summer
A German has to know at least 21 dishes from potato
Try as many dishes from potato as possibe, they are all german traditional food
It\'s a must. There are very good beer in Germany in general. Come over some bars and order different types of beer.
In every corner of Hamburg. The city is a mixture of local people and immigrant. There are ton of vietnamese, thailand, indonesian, chinese restaurants all around the city
A huge breakfast buffet with german tradition bread, cheese and fishes. Let\'s be german for a day
The hanseatic city offers you fish bread and seafood in every corner. American fastfood is also easy to find
Italian, Greece or whatever you want, you will find it here
The city has an amazing public transportation. There are around 10 underground trains going around the city every day.
For the same ticket as train, you can take any bus and see the city from the window
Stadtrad is a project of the city to support protecting environment. Be sure to sign in for Stadtrad before you come, since it costs only 5 euro for signing and you get 30 minutes free for each tour
Walking around the city is not a bad idea as well
If you are quite flexible with finance, find you a comfortable hotel
If you are a student, then hostel is not a bad idea at all. 20-30euro for a night with warm bath and breakfast included
It\'s also very popular in a tourist attraction city like Hamburg
If you prefer to know some local people, go to couchsurfing and ask for a accomodation. People in Hamburg are very friendly and hospital
